Title.evidence: Early Postoperative Oral Hydration in Paediatric Surgery: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Participants.evidence: enrolling children aged 1–5 years, of ASA physical status I–II, undergoing elective surgery under general anaesthesia

Intervention.evidence: early hydration (EH) within 30 minutes of arrival to the post-anaesthesia care unit (PACU) or delayed standard hydration (SH) after 2 hours

Objective.evidence: assessed the impact of early postoperative oral hydration on patient satisfaction and safety

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the FLACC score at 1 hour in PACU

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using sealed, opaque envelopes

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 66 children were randomised between June 2023 and July 2023, with 33 in each group

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis included 61 children, using a per-protocol approach

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median FLACC score after 1 hour in PACU was significantly lower in Group EH [1 (0.25–2)] compared to Group SH [2 (1–3)], with a p-value of 0.028

Harms.evidence: No major complications, such as vomiting or hypoxia, were reported in either group

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered at the Clinical Trials Registry-India (CTRI/2022/06/043291)

Funding.evidence: the study was funded by institutional resources
